Ask HN: Video games that will make me smarter and are addictive?
text:
Don't have much video game experience. Wore out a Nintendo Donkey Kong and Nintendo Mario Bros when I was a kid. Then some Quake on Windows.

I realized the potential of gaming when a couple of games helped me progress my pilot certification (Flight Simulator of course, and X-Plane on iPad).

Haven't don't much video gaming, but do have an addictive personality.

So, it is resolved... I now want to take on positive addictions. I want to get addicted to one or more video games that will make me smarter. They could be about strategy, or reflexes, etc. All are good. Smartness comes in many dimensions.

FLOSS/FOSS preferred.

Currently, I have Windows and ChromeOS laptops, and an Android phone.

Your recommendations are invited below.

Thank you in advance.

Ask HN: Leadership Progression, Isn't this a demotion?
text:
I currently work at an agency and it's coming up on 10yrs that I've been with the company (actually longer about 10.5yrs started off as consultant) and 10.8 years since the company was started. We just brought a CTO on board which the CEO looked to my approval prior to offering him the role. Prior to bringing the CTO on board the CEO was acting in the role of the CTO with the VP of Tech and myself the VP of Engineering assisting. During the time the CTO was being interviewed I just so happened to have my review with the CEO and he presented me with a question on my next steps and growth with the company. As the company is growing the CEO is also establishing an org chart that he's been working on for over 6 months.

My understanding of my role as the VP Of Engineering is that I am tasked with establishing the engineer practice, hiring of engineers, solving issues at the organizational level and managing other managers/leads etc.

The CEO's vision would be to have people specialize in one area with me being presented the role of "Head of Backend".

The question I'm trying to gain clarity on is what is the difference between VP of Engineering and Head of Backend given that we have multiple engineering disciplines (React Native, Frontend and Backend).

Right now I wear the following hats:

- Lead on projects max of 2 (small PM tasks, full feature coding , PR reviewing, system Architect, direct client engagement among other tasks), consultant of many. This also includes managing the Frontend teams, getting company to start using Storybook and componentizing our design

- Part of a team of Sr Engineers to redefine our engineering departments and design practices/work flows(building tools, documentation, best practice / structure). This team was something that the CEO and myself came up with over the past year.

- Hiring Backend developers, 1:1 and mentoring. Solution Architect/Problem solver (may be brought in to help solve full tech solutions no matter the discipline. The issue usually starts as a backend need and then goes into Frontend or Mobile implementation/needs)

The issue I'm having here is how to decide on what my next steps are but also if I choose Head of Backend could that be seen as a demotion or should it be seen as a restructure in limiting the need to wear multiple hats and having a clear career growth path.

I was unwittingly signed up for Amazon Music Unlimited
text:
Got a doozy of a dark pattern from Amazon today. I'm not sure that my order is relevant, but I ordered a cheap clip contact microphone for a tuner. I placed the order and received the confirmation email as expected, but I also received a "Welcome to Amazon Music Unlimited" email as well. I assume I left some box checked or something that I failed to opt out of, but I never saw it. This was a 90 day trial after which it would charge me $9/month. I immediately went to cancel and then got several "are you sure" dialogs with up-sells and confusingly designed buttons to try and get me to keep the service (or even sign up for a higher charged one).

I have to say that although Amazon has fallen quite far in my estimation in the last few years, this is something else - it feels like they'll be hocking magazine subscriptions at me next.

Keep an eye on your subscriptions and credit cards - and I'll be canceling my Prime membership of over a decade. I was on the fence and have been meaning to, but this seals it.

Ask HN: Sites with the quality of Hacker News, but for more general topics?
text:
I've found Reddit posts and comments tend to appeal toward the average person. It's like I'm listening to pop music while reading Reddit comments - the same thing over and over again. The same kind of averageness that gets tiring and unfulfilling to read.

What I like about Hacker News is the comment and link quality is very high. What I like about Reddit is I can read about any topic I want.

Is there something that combines the two?
